articles.title: ECB signals rates lift-off, eyes bigger move in September - Reuters.com
articles.description: The European Central Bank ended a long-running stimulus scheme on Thursday and said it would deliver next month its first interest rate hike since 2011, followed by a potentially larger move in September.
articles.content: FRANKFURT/AMSTERDAM, June 9 (Reuters) - The European Central Bank ended a long-running stimulus scheme on Thursday and said it would deliver next month its first interest rate hike since 2011, follow… [+5057 chars]

articles.author: Rachel McLaughlin
articles.title: EU rule for common smartphone chargers ‘a victory for consumers’ - Donegal Daily
articles.description: The European Union has agreed on a law to require all new smartphones, tablets and laptops to use a common charger by 2026. The move forces Apple to change connections for new iPhones and AirPod cases from the lightning port to USB-C ports. The EU agreement, …
articles.content:
The European Union has agreed on a law to require all new smartphones, tablets and laptops to use a common charger by 2026.

articles.author: Joe Svetlik
articles.title: European law banning Apple's Lightning cables won't apply in UK - What Hi-Fi?
articles.description: USB-C is taking over, but will it be mandatory in the UK?
articles.content:
A European law will make USB-C the standard charging port on all smartphones and tablets in 2024 – but the UK government is not "currently considering" implementing a similar law.

articles.description: At a private event organised by a labour union group, the former German chancellor condemned Russia’s “barbaric war of aggression” and spoke about a “profound break” in Europe’s post-war history.
